listing.name: ! Amazing Fields !
listing.description:
**All the things you always wanted in custom fields but didn‚Äôt know to ask**

As long time users of Trello, we wanted to break out of the limits of the standard Custom Fields powerup.  We wanted all the features we have grown to expect from other tools like customized formatting, conditional styling, selectable icons, and even progress bars. We built this powerup to meet our needs and yours as well.

It includes everything you could wish for:

   * **Number formatting** - currency, scientific, percents, accounting and more
   * **Date formatting** - choose everything about how you want to show the date
   * **Progress bars** - use multiple styles to track progress
   * **Checkbox styles** - select from several types of checkboxes
   * **Field display options** - show on front or back with optional labels
   * **Conditional coloring** - change the badge color based upon field values
   * **Reorder fields** - easily reorder fields live for full control
   * **Advanced editors** - go beyond the basic field editors
   * And more‚Ä¶ - send [new ideas][1]

If there is anything you want and don‚Äôt see, [contact us][1] to suggest something new.  If we use your idea we will give you a free license for life. üéâ

And of course, you can still do everything you always could with Custom Fields.  You can create fields on your cards that let you collect additional information.

   * **Text fields** - collect key information that you need for each card.
   * **Numbers** - track metrics like story points, counts, or any other numbers
   * **Checkbox** - support tracking any on/off style values
   * **Dates** - collect key dates and times to show on the cards

You can install the powerup and use all the capabilities for free.  If you find them useful, then we ask you to please support our work by signing up for a subscription for the cost of a cup of coffee. ‚òï

Features
========

## Date Formatting üìÖ

You are able to choose exactly how you want your dates to show on cards.  Dates and times are show in local internationalized formats.

![Date Formatting Example](https://amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_casts/date_format_cast.gif)

## Number Formatting üßÆ

Select from any combination of number formatting.  All numbers are displayed in the correct location international format, and you can even change the number of decimal places in the number.

![Number Formatting Example](https://amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_casts/number_format_cast.gif)

## Currency Support üí∞

Choose to format the number using international currencies and formatting.

![Currency Example](https://amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_casts/currency_cast.gif)

## Accounting Format üßæ

Supports styling in accounting format to display negative numbers clearly and support accountants on your team.

![Accounting Example](https://amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_casts/accounting_cast.gif)

## Progress Bars üìä

Have you ever wanted to see progress towards a goal on your cards?  Well now you can with progress bars.  You can configure the style, width, range and more.

![Progress Bars Example](https://amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_casts/progressbar_cast.gif)

## Customized Checkboxes ‚òëÔ∏è

No more being restricted to a single boring check style.  Select from a wide range of options.  You can choose to only show a checkbox when it is checked and to hide it otherwise.  Every aspect of how you show it is up to you to choose.  Let us know if there are more styles or options we can add to support your use case.

![Checkboxes Example](https://amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_casts/checkbox_cast.gif)

## Field Display Options üïµÔ∏è

You can choose where and how you want your fields to be displayed.  Choose if they should show on the front, the back, or both.  Also choose if the field should be labeled or stand alone.

![Display Options Example](https://amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_casts/display_options_cast.gif)

## Conditional Badge Coloring üé®

You don't have to use the same boring colors for the badges that show your fields on a card.  You can define conditional formatting rules to change the badge color based upon the value of your field.  This lets you do all types of amazing things like color progress bars based upon percentage completed, highlight text fields based upon content, monitor key dates, and highlight key checkbox values.  If there is something you want a rule for that isn't supported, [let us know][1] and we will add it for you.

![Conditional Coloring Example](https://amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_casts/rule_coloring_cast.gif)


Getting Started
==================

There are a few short steps to get started using the Amazing Fields PowerUp.

1. Enable the powerup to add it to your board

    Click on the add button at the top of this page to add the powerup to a board.

2. Open Amazing Fields PowerUp settings

    Go to the board where Amazing PowerUps is installed and then select the "Show Menu..." button in the upper right.  Click on the "Amazing Fields" powerup in the Power-Up list and select "Edit Power-Up settings".

3. Authorize access to Trello

    The Amazing Fields PowerUp needs your permission to talk to Trello and interact with your boards.  On the general settings page click on "Authorize with Trello".

4. Setup the fields you want

    In the settings panel you can click "Add" to add any new fields you would like.  Then select the field and edit the details about how you would like the field to be shown.

Contact Us
==========

To get help or suggest a new features, please contact us directly at [support@amazingpowerups.com][1].  We love feedback and will get back to you as quickly as possible.


Links
=====
   * [Product Page](https://amazingpowerups.com/product/amazing-fields/)
   * [Privacy Policy](https://amazingpowerups.com/privacy-policy/)
   * [Contact Support][1]


Release History
===============

   * [1.2.0](https://amazingpowerups.com/blog/amazing-fields-1-2-0/)
     * Add conditional badge coloring based upon field values
   * 1.1.0
      * [First public release of Amazing Fields](https://amazingpowerups.com/blog/amazing-fields-initial-release/)
      * UI refinements based upon beta user feedback
      * Automatic testing for improve resiliency
   * 1.0.0
      * Initial release of Amazing Fields


[1]: mailto:support@amazingpowerups.com

listing.name: ! Smart Fields !
listing.description:
![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/Hand%20writing%20intro2.gif)
# Custom Fields on steroids. Harness the power of Javascript in Trello


---
## Get Started with templates
The best way to start with Smart Fields is to check out these templates we have prepared for you:

- [Sales Funnel](https://trello.com/b/5f2864ebfaa29076439b398a/vitalyandr/recommend) 
- [Inventory Management](https://trello.com/b/5f294cfce3d6b4341ee15257/vitalyandr/recommend) 
- [Advanced Project Budgeting and Time Tracking](https://trello.com/b/5f2967cb7c99c5788da38d8e/vitalyandr/recommend) 
- [Date conversion and Calculations using Formulas](https://trello.com/b/5f71f50158a0f13a64b278ea)

To explore these templates in action please create a board from template, read the description of the board to understand workflow and click on Smart fields board button to see the fields and formulas setup.

#Create fields
![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/Create%20fields_.gif)

---
# Use formulas, similar to Excel
Simple but powerful formula editor for all your business needs. We designed it with a straightforward goal in mind: **Simple things should be simple, complex things should be possible**. If you used Excel before you know formulas but **you can go further with the help of Javascript**.

![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/formulas2.png)

To accumulate values create the formula as in the animation below
![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/Formulas%20Accumulate%20values.gif)

---
# Show useful information in the list title
Sum, Average, Min, Max
![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/list%20totals.gif)

---
#Sort cards in the list by field's values

![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/list%20sorters.gif)
---
# Customize the field's appearance
Choose where and how the fields are displayed.

![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/Customize%20fields%20appearence%202.gif)

---
# Track all the changes
Easily see who changed what when.

![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/history.png)

---
# Convenient data entry
Configure certain fields as read-only or hidden. Prepopulate with initial data and more.

![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/data-entry.png)

---
# Export SmartFields data from Trello to Excel
Take the data from SmartFields into Excel for further analysis, reports, charts, etc.

![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/export-csv.png)

---
## Watch the full demo now or start using Smart Fields

![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/SmartFieldsDemov2.gif)

---

**FREE PLAN:**

- Single field - no monthly limit of field value changes
- Multiple fields - Fully functional 
Monthly limit of 10 field value changes. On each board, limits are waived for the first two weeks.
- Unlimited number of users

**PRO PLAN:**

- $4.99/month for each board
- Multiple fields
- Unlimited field value changes
- Unlimited number of users

**Save with Annual Pro Plan**

- 2 boards included
- $49,99/year
- Each additional board $11,99/year

listing.name: Time in List
listing.description:
From the creators of [Corrello - Agile Dashboards](https://getcorrello.com?utm_source=trello&utm_medium=directory&utm_campaign=til_plugin) and [Blue Cat Reports](https://trello.com/power-ups/5d9c90aa18965066fcd44730/reports-by-blue-cat)

### Customer quotes

*"This instantly became one of my favorite Trello Powerups. Knowing how long individual tasks have remained in a given state (list) is incredibly powerful for our use case."*

- **Natalie Heker** [Success Academies]

*"Like Card Aging but done well"* 

- **Tom Sandford** [Founder Future Content]

*"We utilized this board HEAVILY for full scale kanban production cards. Time in List was a game changer - without having to open any cards we could see exactly how long it had been in the current list... set parameters around that for red flags and such as well. And the ability to dig in and see all of the history at a glance was awesome."*

- **Robby Baker** [Marketing Director Holtz Leather co.]

### Get started today

It couldn't be simpler! **Add the Time In List Power-Up** to your boards and see...

**How long each card has been in the current list** on the front of every card, and (optionally) how long it has been on the current board 
 
- Spot slow cards
- Track performance against SLAs
- See which tasks need to get moving today
![Time on cards](https://app.timeinlist.com/public/images/landing/front-badges_ipadair2_gold_landscape.png)

**How long cards spent in past lists** on the back of your cards. 

- For each card, see which part of the process took the longest
- Full history loaded for all cards as soon as the Power-Up is enabled
![Time in past lists](https://app.timeinlist.com/public/images/landing/time-in-past-lists.png)

**Charts showing aggregate data** 

- See which parts of your process are consistently the slowest
- Get averages per list
- Filter by **member** or **label**

![Charts](https://app.timeinlist.com/public/images/landing/chart.png)

Time In List for Trello is the Power-Up your team is missing right now. 
-----

* Spot the stuck cards, **who needs help today?**
* See which parts of your process take the longest, **How could you go faster in future?**
* Track performance against SLAs
* See which cards never make it off your todo list
* Measure your process and improve :)

Start your free trial **add Time In List to your Trello boards today**

Pricing

- Monthly $3/member on your board/s
- Annual (2 months free!) $30/member 
- Note: the same member on multiple boards only counts once

Got questions? Drop us a line at support@timeinlist.com :)


## Our other Power-Ups for Trello

**Corrello [Scrum and Kanban charts](https://trello.com/power-ups/568c2b6c7d2758a55ac48c98/agile-scrum-kanban-dashboards-charts-corrello)**. Burndowns, CFDs, Cycle Time, Release Forecasts and more.

**[Agile Tools](https://trello.com/power-ups/59d4ef8cfea15a55b0086614/agile-tools-by-corrello)**. Lets you add story points to cards (integrates with Corrello) and set WIP limits for individual lists.

**[Burndown Charts for Trello](https://trello.com/power-ups/5eda444d3be9d07a01eb82a4/burndowns-by-corrello)**. The best Burndown Charts for Trello, with daily Slack and Email updates.

**Blue Cat [Trello Reporting](https://trello.com/power-ups/5d9c90aa18965066fcd44730/reports-by-blue-cat)**. Our general purpose Reporting solution for Trello. Build the charts you want, drag and drop to create the dashboard how your team needs it.

**[Kanban WIP](https://trello.com/power-ups/5e621e477907d7774380f551/kanban-wip-by-corrello)**. Allows you to set up WIP limits which will apply across multiple lists.

listing.description:
# Agile Project management dashboards plugin for Trello

*"This is a *really* nice product. I'm really happy with what you've built here. It's everything I need in a Scrum/Kanban tool and nothing I don't. Blows JIRA completely out of the water."*

- Scott McCoy (Software Engineer at **OpenX**)

## Detailed metrics for Scrum and Kanban teams

Corrello is a Scrum and Kanban extension that instantly and seamlessly integrates with Trello. Connect Corrello today and get the charts you need in seconds. You can get the charts and reports you need for true agile project management, your team can continue using the tool they love.

![Agile Metrics for Trello](https://app.getcorrello.com/public/images/powerup/cfd.png)

## Analytics and charts for your Scrum boards

With Corrello‚Äôs **burndown** charts you have the everything you need to keep your team on track day to day during your sprints. You can also review past sprints and velocity during your retrospectives to help your team improve their Scrum process. 

Corrello also fully integrates with [Story Points](https://trello.com/power-ups/59d4ef8cfea15a55b0086614/agile-tools-by-corrello) from the Agile Tools power-up

## Reporting and Analytics for your Kanban boards

With Corrello‚Äôs **CFD** and **Cycle Time** charts you have the everything you need to show your team how they are working and help them identify the bottlenecks where they can improve. Our **WIP Age** charts help direct daily activity. 

## Estimate your progress and backlogs

Corrello also helps with reporting outside the team. Our **Burnup** chart tracks progress towards completion of an overall project goal on your Scrum or Kanban boards.

## 'Master' your Agile Project management with Corrello's reporting and analytics

Corrello offers all the charts, metrics and analytics you need to track and analyze your team's progress, including:

## Burndown charts

**Only interested in Burndowns Charts?** Then please check out our [Burndowns for Trello](https://trello.com/power-ups/5eda444d3be9d07a01eb82a4/burndowns-by-corrello) Power-Up

Manage your Sprints and stay on schedule with the Sprint Burndown chart. Burndown charts show the number of cards outstanding in your sprint each day, burning down to 0 at the end of your sprint (hopefully)

![Scrum team Burndown](https://app.getcorrello.com/public/images/powerup/burndown.png)

### What is a Burndown Chart?

A Burndown Chart (or Sprint Burndown Chart) is used by Scrum teams to track progress through the Sprint. There will be an *ideal* line plotted showing how many cards or points would be completed each day assuming all work is completed by the end of the Sprint. There will also be an *actual* line showing the amount of work remaining each day. By the end of the sprint the *actual* line should be at 0 and there is no work remaining.

### How is a Burndown Chart Calculated?

The *actual* burndown line is plotted to show the amount of work remaining each day (the work which needs to burndown). The *ideal* line on a Burndown Chart shows how much work would be remaining each day if all work was completed in the sprint. The ideal line assumes the same amount of work will be completed each day. As work is completed you will see the actual line burndown towards the bottom of the chart.

### How to use a Burndown Chart in Scrum?

![How to use a Burndown Chart](https://app.getcorrello.com/public/images/explainers/burndown-what-is.png)

During the Sprint it is useful to compare your *actual* burndown to your *ideal* burndown. If you are above the ideal then you are behind schedule (this may not be uncommon in the early parts of your Sprint). If you are on or below the ideal line then you are ahead of schedule. If you are very far behind you may want to remove some work from the Sprint so you can complete what is left. If you are very far ahead you may want to add some more work. If you often end up adding or removing work you will probably want the team to look carefully at how much work they add in to future sprints to try and avoid that.

## Cycle Time charts

See Cycle and Lead times for your Trello boards. Broken down with a Control Chart and Cycle Time Histogram. The list by list breakdown of cycle times helps you identify bottlenecks with your teams.

![Cycletime chart for Kanban](https://app.getcorrello.com/public/images/powerup/cycle_time.png)

### What is a Cycle Time Chart?

Cycle Time is a measure of the time elapsed between work starting and work being completed on a task. A Cycle Time Chart (or Control Chart) shows each card completed with the date it was completed on the x-axis. The number of days it took to complete is plotted against the y-axis.

Cycle Time is also often plotted on a histogram showing the cycle time days on the x-axis. The number of tasks which took that long to complete are plotted against the y-axis. This can be useful to see how long cards typically take to complete.

### How to use a Cycle Time Chart?

![How to use a Cycle Time Chart](https://app.getcorrello.com/public/images/explainers/cycle-time-what-is.png)

Cycle Time Charts can be used to find outliers (cards which took unusually long to complete). This can be useful for discussions with the team on how the process could be improved. 

You can also look at the cycle time trends over time, to see if cycle time is steady or improving/worsening. If cycle time is increasing over time you may want to look at how much work the team is taking on at once. Often longer cycle times are a result of teams taking on too much work and losing time to context switching.

### How is Cycle Time Calculated?

Cycle Time is a measure of the time elapsed between work starting on a task and work being completed. Cycle time is typically recorded in days, with any partial days being rounded up. A task started and completed in the same day will record 1 day of cycle time.

### Cycle Time vs Lead Time

Cycle Time is a measure of time to complete work from when work is started on it. Lead time is a measure of time to complete work from when the work is committed to. It is likely that your external partners may be more interested in lead time. Internally Cycle Time may be the more useful measure for the team, but being aware of Lead Time can also be useful.

## Cumulative Flow Diagram

Check for bottlenecks with our CFD chart. See where work builds up in individual lists. Or quickly filter to see WIP or Backlog lists only and see how your board is behaving

![Kanban team CFD Cumulative Flow Diagram](https://app.getcorrello.com/public/images/powerup/cfd.png)

### What is a Cumulative Flow Diagram?

A Cumulative Flow Diagram tracks the number of cards in each list at the end of each day, and accumulates cards in done at the bottom of the chart. This can be useful to see how cards move through the whole process and can often help identify bottlenecks in the system.

### What can you learn from a Cumulative Flow Diagram?

![How does a CFD work](https://app.getcorrello.com/public/images/explainers/cfd-what-is.png)

You can learn these things from your Cumulative Flow Diagram

- Is WIP (Work In Progress) building up over time?
- Is the Backlog building up over time?
- Is work in any individual lists building up over time?
- Is work getting done at a constant rate?

If WIP is building up, it would be a good idea to try and focus the team on completing existing work before starting anything new.

If the Backlog is building up, you may want to be careful about committing to more work before the team has completed some of what it has already committed to.

Individual lists building up can show a bottleneck around that list, talk to the team to see if anything can be done to get the cards in that list moving.

## WIP Age Charts

See cycle time issues before they become a problem, stop starting and start finishing with our WIP Age view! Easily see cards which have been in their current list, or in progress, longer than average.

![WIP Age for Trello Kanban Teams](https://app.getcorrello.com/public/images/explainers/wip-age-what-is.png)

### What does WIP mean?

WIP stands for Work In Progres. It is a count of all the work current in progress. Teams often try to limit WIP to ensure they aren't losing time to context switching.

### What is WIP Aging?

WIP Aging measures the age of current in progress tasks. This is as opposed to Cycle Time which measures the age of completed work. By looking at the age of in progress tasks you can focus your team on the oldest tasks and make sure work gets through the process at a consistent pace.

### Do lower WIP limits improve Flow?

Lower WIP limits often improve throughput of a process. We could talk about [Little's law](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Little%27s_law), but it is simpler to think of a simple example. Imagine a single person wrapping christmas presents. If they try to wrap 10 all at once they will complete them all at the same time, but until then none are complete. By completing them one at a time they can get some presents wrapped sooner. And by keeping things simpler for themselves, focusing on a single task at a time, they can probably finish faster.

### How to set WIP limits in Trello?

We recommend either the [Kanban WIP](https://trello.com/power-ups/5e621e477907d7774380f551/kanban-wip-by-corrello) or [List Limits](https://trello.com/power-ups/5c2462c384ab8949b1724a20/list-limits) Power-Up.

## Burnup Charts

Track progress towards your goals and forecast when work will be completed with our release forecast burnup chart. Work remaining on your backlog is charted as the upper line, work completed is burnt up towards the total. We forecast a projection forward showing when you will likely complete your current backlog.

![Backlog forecast burnup chart for Trello](https://app.getcorrello.com/public/images/burnup.png)

### What is a Burnup Chart?

A burnup chart tracks the total scope of the project, and the work completed in the project. The work completed 'burns up' towards the total scope line.

### How do you read a Burnup Chart?

The upper line is the total scope of the project, when tasks are added it will move up and when tasks are removed it will move down. The lower line is the amount of work completed in the project. As tasks are completed this line burns up towards the total scope. When you look at Burnup charts it becomes apparent that the rate work is completed remains pretty steady over time. The easiest way to get the project completed on a specific date is often to reduce (or stop adding!) scope.

## Kanban metrics and analytics software for trello

Corrello is ideal for both Scrum and Kanban teams, or those teams working with a mix of both Scrum and Kanban (Scrumban anyone!)

*"**Corrello has transformed Trello from a delightful way to organize work into a powerful agile project management tool.** If you are using Trello to manage any Scrum, Kanban or other agile process, **get Corrello now. You are flying blind without it**."*

- Chris Brookins (CPO **HelpScout**)

*"**Corrello gives us actionable data we use to effectively manage our development process**, without the team needing to do anything new and without any changes needed to their workflow."*

- Sam Stagg (VP Eng **Pusher**)

*"The best agile tool for Trello"*

- Anita Taylor (PM **Stack Overflow**) 

## [FAQs]

### How do I use trello as a Kanban board?

Trello boards are naturally Kanban boards. Simply‚Ä¶

- Create your new Trello Board (give it a name!)
- Map out your process (from todo to done) as Lists on your Board
- [Optional] Add the List Limits Power-Up and set WIP limits for your lists
- Create Cards for each task
- [Optional] create Checklists on Cards if you have subtasks
- Invite your team and assign members to Cards 
- Add labels (ie Bug, Blocked) to Cards if needed
- [Optional] if you really want to get the most from Kanban it is worth installing a Power-Up like [Corrello Agile Metrics](https://trello.com/power-ups/568c2b6c7d2758a55ac48c98/agile-dashboards-by-corrello) 

### How do I use Trello as a Scrum board?

Trello lends itself really nicely to Scrum. To get started with your first Sprint

- Create a new Trello Board for your team or project
- Map out your process (from todo to done) as Lists on your Board. Include a 'Sprint Backlog' List
- Add the cards for the current Sprint to your Sprint Backlog
- [Optional] create Checklists on Cards if you have subtasks
- Invite your team and assign members to Cards
- Add labels (ie Bug, Blocked) to Cards if needed
- Once your Sprint is complete, keep the same board and add the next Sprint into the Sprint Backlog
- [Optional] if you really want to get the most from Scrum it is worth installing a Power-Up like [Corrello Agile Metrics](https://trello.com/power-ups/568c2b6c7d2758a55ac48c98/agile-dashboards-by-corrello) or [Burndowns for Trello](https://trello.com/power-ups/5eda444d3be9d07a01eb82a4/burndowns-by-corrello)

### Is Trello an agile tool?

Trello can absolutely be used as an Agile tool, and is used by a lot of large successful teams. Remember that one of the most effective ways to manage agile development is with index cards blu tacked to a wall! If that is an Agile tool don't let anyone tell you that you need Jira or more complex tools to 'properly' manage an agile project.

### Top tips for agile project management using trello

We've worked with 1000's of teams using Trello for their Agile projects, and we've seen a few consistent things which work best

1. Keep the same board between sprints, **please** don't create a new board for every sprint without good reason
1. Check out the Custom Fields Power-Up, this is great for when your Labels start getting a bit unruly
1. Don't let anyone tell you Trello can't be used for serious projects, it's got everything you need to run a Scrum or Kanban project
1. Break up your process into multiple lists, this makes it easier to see *where* in the process cards build up
1. Use a 'blocked' label for blocked cards rather than a list, this way you can see where blocked cards are in the process. Plus, adding a label is a single click (click the number button for the label in question)
1. Use Checklists for child tasks, when that gets too complex take the hint and break your card down into multiple smaller tasks.
1. Create 'template checklists' for things like Code Review where you want the same tasks on every card
1. Use markdown to put user stories directly on the back of you Cards
1. Install an analytics tool like [Corrello Agile Metrics](https://trello.com/power-ups/568c2b6c7d2758a55ac48c98/agile-dashboards-by-corrello) or [Burndowns for Trello](https://trello.com/power-ups/5eda444d3be9d07a01eb82a4/burndowns-by-corrello) to help your team keep on top of their process

Also, check out these articles and resources

- [Scrum with Trello](https://www.infoq.com/articles/scrum-trello/) This is also useful for Kanban Teams
- [Agile Sprint Board template](https://trello.com/templates/engineering/agile-sprint-board-ZqN99gGN)
- [Kanban Board Template](https://trello.com/templates/engineering/kanban-template-LGHXvZNL)
- [Agile Project Management with Trello](https://blog.trello.com/manage-scrum-and-kanban-teams-with-trello-corrello-power-up)
- [Accelerate Agile Teams on Trello](https://blog.trello.com/accelerate-agile-teams)

### How do I add story points for Trello?

We recommend using the [Agile Tools power-up](https://trello.com/power-ups/59d4ef8cfea15a55b0086614/agile-tools-by-corrello) to add points to your Trello Cards.

### Trello Vs Jira for Scrum/Kanban

Trello can be a great tool for Scrum or Kanban teams. We think the best choice is to use the tool the team is happiest with. The greatest tool in the world is worth nothing if the team aren't keeping it up to date. Trello is so simple to use, and most people have some experience with it in their personal or professional life already. There really aren't many things you can't get from Trello (plus a few Power-Ups) which you could get from any other tool

## Reporting for Trello

Looking for general purpose **[Trello Reporting](https://trello.com/power-ups/5d9c90aa18965066fcd44730/reports-by-blue-cat)?** Blue Cat Reports is our general purpose Reporting solution for Trello. Build the charts you want, drag and drop to create the dashboard how your team needs it.

- [Optional] if you really want to get the most from Scrum it is worth installing a Power-Up like [Corrello Agile Metrics](https://trello.com/power-ups/568c2b6c7d2758a55ac48c98/agile-dashboards-by-corrello) or [Burndowns for Trello](https://trello.com/power-ups/5eda444d3be9d07a01eb82a4/burndowns-by-corrello)

### Is Trello an agile tool?

Trello can absolutely be used as an Agile tool, and is used by a lot of large successful teams. Remember that one of the most effective ways to manage agile development is with index cards blu tacked to a wall! If that is an Agile tool don't let anyone tell you that you need Jira or more complex tools to 'properly' manage an agile project.

### Top tips for agile project management using trello

We've worked with 1000's of teams using Trello for their Agile projects, and we've seen a few consistent things which work best

1. Keep the same board between sprints, **please** don't create a new board for every sprint without good reason
1. Check out the Custom Fields Power-Up, this is great for when your Labels start getting a bit unruly
1. Don't let anyone tell you Trello can't be used for serious projects, it's got everything you need to run a Scrum or Kanban project
1. Break up your process into multiple lists, this makes it easier to see *where* in the process cards build up
1. Use a 'blocked' label for blocked cards rather than a list, this way you can see where blocked cards are in the process. Plus, adding a label is a single click (click the number button for the label in question)
1. Use Checklists for child tasks, when that gets too complex take the hint and break your card down into multiple smaller tasks.
1. Create 'template checklists' for things like Code Review where you want the same tasks on every card
1. Use markdown to put user stories directly on the back of you Cards
1. Install an analytics tool like [Corrello Agile Metrics](https://trello.com/power-ups/568c2b6c7d2758a55ac48c98/agile-dashboards-by-corrello) or [Burndowns for Trello](https://trello.com/power-ups/5eda444d3be9d07a01eb82a4/burndowns-by-corrello) to help your team keep on top of their process

Also, check out these articles and resources

- [Scrum with Trello](https://www.infoq.com/articles/scrum-trello/) This is also useful for Kanban Teams
- [Agile Sprint Board template](https://trello.com/templates/engineering/agile-sprint-board-ZqN99gGN)
- [Kanban Board Template](https://trello.com/templates/engineering/kanban-template-LGHXvZNL)
- [Agile Project Management with Trello](https://blog.trello.com/manage-scrum-and-kanban-teams-with-trello-corrello-power-up)
- [Accelerate Agile Teams on Trello](https://blog.trello.com/accelerate-agile-teams)

### How do I add story points for Trello?

We recommend using the [Agile Tools power-up](https://trello.com/power-ups/59d4ef8cfea15a55b0086614/agile-tools-by-corrello) to add points to your Trello Cards.

### Trello Vs Jira for Scrum/Kanban

Trello can be a great tool for Scrum or Kanban teams. We think the best choice is to use the tool the team is happiest with. The greatest tool in the world is worth nothing if the team aren't keeping it up to date. Trello is so simple to use, and most people have some experience with it in their personal or professional life already. There really aren't many things you can't get from Trello (plus a few Power-Ups) which you could get from any other tool

## Reporting for Trello

Looking for general purpose **[Trello Reporting](https://trello.com/power-ups/5d9c90aa18965066fcd44730/reports-by-blue-cat)?** Blue Cat Reports is our general purpose Reporting solution for Trello. Build the charts you want, drag and drop to create the dashboard how your team needs it.

listing.description:
![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/Hand%20writing%20intro2.gif)
# Custom Fields on steroids. Harness the power of Javascript in Trello


---
## Get Started with templates
The best way to start with Smart Fields is to check out these templates we have prepared for you:

- [Sales Funnel](https://trello.com/b/5f2864ebfaa29076439b398a/vitalyandr/recommend) 
- [Inventory Management](https://trello.com/b/5f294cfce3d6b4341ee15257/vitalyandr/recommend) 
- [Advanced Project Budgeting and Time Tracking](https://trello.com/b/5f2967cb7c99c5788da38d8e/vitalyandr/recommend) 
- [Date conversion and Calculations using Formulas](https://trello.com/b/5f71f50158a0f13a64b278ea)

To explore these templates in action please create a board from template, read the description of the board to understand workflow and click on Smart fields board button to see the fields and formulas setup.

#Create fields
![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/Create%20fields_.gif)

---
# Use formulas, similar to Excel
Simple but powerful formula editor for all your business needs. We designed it with a straightforward goal in mind: **Simple things should be simple, complex things should be possible**. If you used Excel before you know formulas but **you can go further with the help of Javascript**.

![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/formulas2.png)

To accumulate values create the formula as in the animation below
![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/Formulas%20Accumulate%20values.gif)

---
# Show useful information in the list title
Sum, Average, Min, Max
![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/list%20totals.gif)

---
#Sort cards in the list by field's values

![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/list%20sorters.gif)
---
# Customize the field's appearance
Choose where and how the fields are displayed.

![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/Customize%20fields%20appearence%202.gif)

---
# Track all the changes
Easily see who changed what when.

![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/history.png)

---
# Convenient data entry
Configure certain fields as read-only or hidden. Prepopulate with initial data and more.

![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/data-entry.png)

---
# Export SmartFields data from Trello to Excel
Take the data from SmartFields into Excel for further analysis, reports, charts, etc.

![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/export-csv.png)

---
## Watch the full demo now or start using Smart Fields

![](https://assets.smartfieldsfortrello.com/SmartFieldsDemov2.gif)

---

**FREE PLAN:**

- Single field - no monthly limit of field value changes
- Multiple fields - Fully functional 
Monthly limit of 10 field value changes. On each board, limits are waived for the first two weeks.
- Unlimited number of users

**PRO PLAN:**

- $4.99/month for each board
- Multiple fields
- Unlimited field value changes
- Unlimited number of users

**Save with Annual Pro Plan**

- 2 boards included
- $49,99/year
- Each additional board $11,99/year
